item.title: Our Shift to Smaller, More Focused Products
item.description: TL;DR: Today I am announcing we are no longer accepting new customers on our trading platform. Current customers, don't worry nothing is changing for you.

item.title: How do I fund my account?
item.description: Funding is the one thing you can not do within Options Cafe. You must login to your Tradier Brokerage account and fund through Tradier. Here is the direct link to fund your account. Click Here To Fund Your Tradier Brokerage Account As a reminder, commission-free trading with Options Cafe is powered by Tradier brokerage. All trades through Options Cafe are routed through Tradier. In fact, you can login to Tradier directly and use their web interface to trade as well.

item.title: Do you take trust accounts?
item.description: Tradier does support trust accounts, but they need to be set up manually.  Trust accounts are considered professional accounts according to the NYSE and other market centers that provide real-time quotes.  The estimated cost for this is $100/month. Please contact Tradier customer support directly to set up your account. You can email them at service@tradierbrokerage.com and mention you want to set up a trust account that will be linked to Options Cafe.

item.title: My SPY Put Credit Spread Trades For October 2019
item.description: Happy Halloween! We recouped some of our August losses in October. A good month with some winning trades.

item.title: Who is Tradier Brokerage, Inc?
item.description: Tradier Brokerage, Inc. is a FINRA and SIPC registered broker-dealer that provides cloud-based brokerage services to hundreds of 3rd party investment, advisory, and financial media firms, including Options Cafe. Options Cafe has entered into an agreement with Tradier Brokerage, Inc. to provide access to stock and options trading via Options Cafe. Tradier is integrated into over 100 companies offering technical trading, scanning, options analysis, education, and digital advisors. Because of its technology and focus on active traders, Tradier has today become one of the largest destinations to process Equity and Options trading volume.

item.description: It seems fall is here! We recouped some of our August losses in September. A good month with some winning trades.

item.description: Had a small lost in Aug. Took the lost as I was afraid it might turn into a bigger loss.

item.title: My SPY Put Credit Spread Trades For July 2019
item.description: Another great month of trading put credit spread on the SPY. Very excited about this uptick!

item.title: Earning Income With Bear Call Spreads
item.description: Bearish pressure on a stock can generate profits for short sellers. It can also earn money for option traders. Using a bear call spread, a net premium is earned, and this income will be pocketed if the stock makes just a modest decline.

item.title: My SPY Put Credit Spread Trades For June 2019
item.description: Another great month of trading put credit spreads on the SPY!

item.title: My SPY Put Credit Spread Trades For May 2019
item.description:
Had some losses in May. Never fun to have losses.

Just remember drawdowns are normal and planned for.

item.title: Credit Spread Options Provide Steady Monthly Income
item.description: A credit spread option is an act of taking two or more options and selling the premium they produce. Yes, that sounds confusing. I'll explain, but first, let's explore quickly the concept of writing a contract. In this post, we will explore how traders can make monthly income trading options via spreads.

item.title: Implementing a Short Calendar Spread with Call Options
item.description: When you foresee upcoming volatility in a stock, an option play that can make money from it is the short call calendar spread. Because there are two expiration dates in the strategy, it has a considerable amount of complexity and should only be attempted by experienced traders.

item.title: My SPY Put Credit Spread Trades For April 2019
item.description:
April showers bring epic put credit spread trades! Another good month of trading!

Our Put Credit Spreads strategy is looking good!

item.title: My SPY Put Credit Spread Trades For March 2019
item.description:
March had some good trades!! A very winning month. The best part about the month, for me at least, is Oregon had some epic snow. I had some amazing turns in! I digress.....back to options.

Our Put Credit Spreads strategy is looking good!

item.title: My SPY Put Credit Spread Trades For February 2019
item.description:
February......The month of love.....(at least here in the US)......The market gave us tons of love!!

Finally, some winning trades this month for our Put Credit Spreads strategy. These wins really helped build back up our drawdown from past months.

item.title: My SPY Put Credit Spread Trades For January 2019
item.description: More losses this month for our Put Credit Spreads strategy. Mainly a losing trade that was put on in 2018 and crossed over. I think the markets are calming down and we will start to draw back up.

item.title: Options Cafe Has Launched
item.description: I have some big news!! Today, we are officially announcing the launch of Options Cafe. You can now use our platform to make options trades via Tradier. No other trading platform allows you to discover, trade, and review your trades like Options Cafe. We have built Options Cafe from the ground up with one thing in mind — making multi-leg options trading a snap. Also, get commission-free stock and options trades.

item.title: My SPY Put Credit Spread Trades For December 2018
item.description: Wow! What an unfortunate month for Put Credit Spreads. Afraid this month returned all my yearly gains and then some. A bit of a disappointing way to end the year. We know months like this will happen.

item.title: My SPY Put Credit Spread Trades For November 2018
item.description: Well, finally an engaging month. Afraid the engagement was in the wrong direction. In November we took some losses. Not a big deal since we have had so many winning past months. However, losses are never fun.

item.description: With October 2018 completed we move on to November. Again this was a little bit of a boring month as we only closed one trade. We do have some trades on the board that will close in November.

item.title: What brokers work with Options Cafe?
item.description: Currently, we only support Tradier. To use Options Cafe you will need an account with Tradier. If you're not familiar with Tradier we highly suggest you check them out. They have some of the cheapest prices in the industry with some of the best customer support. We are actively considering adding other brokers to the platform. If there is a broker you really want to use please send us a note to support.

item.title: My SPY Put Credit Spread Trades For September 2018
item.description: With September 2018 over we look forward to autumn. This was a little bit of a boring month as we only closed one trade. We do have some trades on the board that will close in October.

item.title: My SPY Put Credit Spread Trades For August 2018
item.description: With August 2018 in the bag we look forward to September. Traders leave their Hamptons pads and get back to work. My SPY Put Credit Spread trading strategy only closed one trade this month. Hoping for a creep up in IVR next month.

item.title: My SPY Put Credit Spread Trades For July 2018
item.description: July has come and gone. We partied for America's birthday and closed a few profitable trades! Darn good month! My SPY Put Credit Spread trading strategy continued to do well.

item.title: My SPY Put Credit Spread Trades For June 2018
item.description: June 2018 was another winning month for my SPY Put Credit Spread trading strategy. Since IVR has been pretty low closing this many trades was a darn good thing. Just have to be careful to not trade too big.

item.title: My SPY Put Credit Spread Trades For May 2018
item.description: May 2018 was a winning month for my SPY Put Credit Spread trading strategy. It felt good to lock away some winning trades after last month.

item.title: How To Lower Your Stock Basis Using Options
item.description: Throughout my investing career, I have always applied my energies to basis reduction and not seeking discounts when buying a position in a company. I love to use call options or put credit spreads to reduce the basis of a core holding. In this post, I will share with you some of my basis reducing ideas.

item.title: Short Strangles Offer Small Rewards And Significant Risks
item.description: The short strangle option strategy is an opportunity to profit when a stock moves sideways. Instead of just selling one call or one put, you sell one of each, which produces twice the income. But the maximum loss with this type of trade is unlimited, while the potential gain is capped at the amount of premiums received.

item.title: My SPY Put Credit Spread Trades For April 2018
item.description: April 2018 was a losing month for my SPY Put Credit Spread trading strategy. While these months are never fun they serve as an opportunity to remember to be humble in this trading strategy.

item.title: My SPY Put Credit Spread Trades For March 2018
item.description: Here we explore the put credit spread trades I placed on the SPY durning the month of March 2018. This is my primary trading strategy for monthly income. By trading put credit spreads on the SPY I am typically in a trade for 23 days but no more than 45 days.

item.title: My SPY Put Credit Spread Trades For February 2018
item.description: Volatility is back! Seems the day of the market just creeping up every day are over. In February 2018 the market tanked creating tons of new opportunities for entering Put Credit Spread trades. Sadly, we took some losses but in this post I explain that is not a bad thing.

item.title: My SPY Put Credit Spread Trades For January 2018 (or lack there of)
item.description: In January 2018 the markets where pretty stable -- Well stable in the eyes of an options volatility trader. It was not until the end of January when the market made a turn and volatility came back into the market. I opened a few trades in January 2018 but none closed.

item.title: How to Trade Earnings with Straddles and Strangles
item.description: American corporations release their earnings reports every 3 months. The data gives investors an idea of how well the companies are doing financially. If an earnings announcement contains any information traders weren’t expecting, the stock price could plummet or skyrocket, depending on whether the release is negative or positive.

item.title: My SPY Put Credit Spread Trades For December 2017
item.description: Options traders in December were laughing like this kid all the way to the bank! Well maybe not really. No retirement plans just yet. After a bit of a dry spell I closed 2 put credit spread trades. This month is a good example of why you never second guess your strategy. You will notice I put on 2 spreads a day apart with nearly the same strikes prices and the same expiration.

item.title: My SPY Put Credit Spread Trades For November 2017
item.description:
If you are an options volatility trader November was a boring month. I opened 2 put credit spread trades in November -- none closed. We will look at these closing trades in December.

We are in sit and wait mode. Just like this dog......

item.title: Commission Free Trading Costs Per Year
item.description: On the Options Cafe home page, we compare our pricing to other brokers on a per year basis by adding up all the commissions another broker would charge based on your type of trade, number of trades per month, and the lot size of your trades. This tool is intended for a quick comparison. Brokers may change their pricing without notice. If you are concern please always verify our numbers to the pricing marketed by other brokers directly.

item.title: Using the options screener
item.description: One of the most powerful features of Options Cafe is the ability to screen for options to trade. This can save traders hours of searching by hand. With our screener, you can define a strategy and a set of filters. In the video below we walk through screening for a put credit spread trade on the SPY.

item.title: My SPY Put Credit Spread Trades For October 2017 (or lack there of)
item.description: If your an options volatility trader this is how you felt in the month of October. I was unable to open any put credit spread trades in October. Bottomline......volatility was super low! I think the market is just sort of flat waiting for tax reform.

item.title: Tradier and the On-Going Options Trading Software Revolution
item.description: Tradier is a powerful brokerage API that allows non-brokers to provide broker services. Let’s talk about why Options Cafe selected Tradier as our first official partner.

item.title: The Long Calendar Spread Explained
item.description: Instead of trading stocks or other securities, why not trade time? The long calendar spread allows you to buy and sell option contracts with different expiration dates, with the likelihood of profiting from time decay. The maximum loss of this strategy is capped at the net debit the investment incurs at the entry point.

item.title: Jumping From Stock Investing to Options Trading
item.description: Many stock traders are jumping into options trading. Options offer a fantastic way to diversify and to produce extraordinary returns. Let’s look at the key differences between options and stocks, and why so many stock traders are becoming options traders.

item.title: How to Profit with a Short Calendar Spread
item.description: The short calendar spread is a good opportunity to profit from a stock’s impending upswing or decline. The maximum gain from the investment is the net credit received when entering the trade, and the maximum loss could be substantial. Therefore, this option strategy should only be used by experienced traders.

item.title: Introduction to the Butterfly Spread Options Trading Strategy
item.description: The options butterfly spread is a low-risk options trading strategy that stands a high chance of producing a small profit. The butterfly options trading strategy uses four options contracts to produce profits off of price stable markets.

item.title: My SPY Put Credit Spread Trades For September 2017
item.description: Once again it is time for our monthly summary of trades I closed. Below are the put credit spread trades I closed in September 2017. My birthday month!! Compared to August a number of put credit spreads closed this month. Volatility continues to be very low. When volatility is low we have less opportunities to place trades. Click to take a look at the trades.

item.title: How Does Volatility Affect Option Prices
item.description: There are six variables that determine an option’s theoretical value. But, theoretical value is not the same things as market value. The thing that links theoretical and market value together is one key variable out of the whole mix. This one key variable is volatility and it has a huge influence on how an option is going to trade.

item.title: How Successful Options Traders Generate Monthly Income
item.description: Many people think they can quit their day job and start day trading. The truth is, most do not succeed day trading long term. There is an alternative that can generate monthly income just like you hoped to do by day trading. In this post we explore the concept of selling premium in the options market using probability-based options trading.

item.title: Learning The Short Butterfly Strategy
item.description: The short butterfly option trading strategy is a good way to earn small profits, while keeping downside risk to a bare minimum. If you think a stock is set to experience a sizeable move, either up or down, break out your short butterfly playbook.

item.title: A Quick Guide to Paper Trading Options & Newbie Investing
item.description: Paper trading options is one of the best ways to learn options trading. Learn for example how put credit spreads can boast your returns. When paper trading you can learn first hand about all the different aspects of trading options. Learn how volatility affects premium. Learn to profit from time decay. In this post we are going to explore how to paper trade real options.

item.title: Do you provide phone support or phone training?
item.description: We sure do. You can call us at 503-756-1960. We also provide training over the phone or more ideally via a screen share meeting. If you are interested in getting one on one support from us it is best to send us an email at help@options.cafe and we will schedule a time.

item.title: How to setup your Tradier Brokerage account?
item.description: If you are already a Tradier customer simply email us at help@options.cafe and we will take it from there. We have to activate your commission-free pricing. If you are new to Options Cafe / Tradier first you will have to set up a Tradier Brokerage account. Click Here To Signup For Tradier Brokerage By clicking on the link above you will be redirected to a special signup form that will automatically link your Options Cafe account with your new Tradier account.

item.title: What options strategies does Options Cafe support?
item.description: Here is a list of options strategies we currently support. Put Credit Spreads Call Credit Spreads Put Debit Spreads Call Debit Spreads Iron Condors Reverse Iron Condors We are adding new strategies every day. If your favorite strategy is not listed please check back in. Better yet send us a message at help@options.cafe and let us know what you prefer to trade. We promise to move quickly on adding your prefered strategy.

item.title: Trading Option Greeks : An Example Trade
item.description: Knowing how the Greeks influence premium is not academic. Understanding how they are likely to affect your next trade is a critical component of that trade’s set up. You should always perform an analysis of the Greeks before you send an order to your broker. Here are some important things to look for.

item.title: My SPY Put Credit Spread Trades For August 2017
item.description: If your a follower of this blog or a follower of my trades you might have noticed I stopped posting trades. That is all about to change starting with this post. I am once again committed to posting the trades I place monthly. The reason for the absence in trade posting is we have been crazy busy preparing for the launch of our new trading platform -- Just not enough hours in the day :(.

item.title: The Butterfly Spread is a Great Low-Risk Investing Strategy
item.description: If you want a conservative option investment that controls losses, take a look at the butterfly strategy. This derivative tactic comes with finite profitability, but also downside protection. The butterfly play is best for stocks that have low volatility.

item.title: How Option Greeks Affect The Premium You Trade
item.description: Most traders realize that options increase or decrease in value as the underlying stock moves up or down in price. But, there’s a lot more to how an option’s price changes over the course of time before expiration. A better understanding of option greeks will go a long way to improving the success of your trades.

item.title: Making Money Trading Delta Options Is One Of The Best Ways To Trade Options
item.description: Making money trading delta options is how top options traders trade. What many traders don’t consider is that your delta doesn’t have to stay consistent throughout a trade. Many professional options traders manage their positions in order to add or decrease delta.

item.title: Volatility Trading Allows Options Traders To Think Different
item.description: Volatility Trading is a variable in an option pricing model used to determine the theoretical value of an option. And, among all the variables in an option pricing model, it is the only one that is derived from market sentiment. But, the market doesn’t always get it right. That creates opportunity for an options trader.

item.title: How I Prevent Emotional Trading
item.description: Over the years I have learned that there is no upside to emotional trading. The market is random, and if you try to guess what the next tick will be you will lose. In this post I walk you through designing a trading strategy that prevents your emotions from sabotaging your trading through the wildest of times.

item.title: Short Straddles Can Be A Profitable Options Strategy In Flat Markets
item.description: Short straddles present an opportunity to make a profit whenever a stock appears stuck in a neutral price zone. This option strategy generates extra income by selling double the usual number of contracts. While the profitability is capped at the amount of premiums received, the potential loss is unlimited.

item.title: The Different Types Of Options: Stocks, Commodities, Binary, and More
item.description: There are many different types of options. While stock options are perhaps the most well-known, options can be created for many other types of assets, such as currencies, commodity futures, and other assets. Let’s go over some of the many types of options and their key differences.

item.title: Long Delta Strategies : What is Delta?
item.description: Have you ever entered an options position and had difficulty understanding how the price fluctuates? Perhaps you were confused by the amount of profit or loss caused by stock movement relative to your position? If this has ever happened to you, you could learn more about delta, and how long delta strategies fits into your trading strategy.

item.title: Iron Condor Explained
item.description: The Iron Condor is a very useful options trading strategy. While considered "advanced" by many, once you get a good handle on the iron condor, traders at any level can use it. This options trading strategy is especially useful for profiting off of stable markets that are experiencing sideways price movements. Next up ........Iron Condor Explained.

item.title: How To Profit Using Long Straddles
item.description: Although volatility is often spoken of in the financial press as undesirable, long straddles are one case where you can profit from it. If you foresee major price swings in the near future. Time to learn about long straddles.

item.title: Stockpeer.com Blog Becomes Options Cafe Software: New Name, New Vision
item.description: Say hello to Options Cafe! I am excited to announce that the Stockpeer blog is retiring and Options Cafe is taking over. Options Trading Software is coming. Fast forward to today, and options have become the bulk of my trading activity.

item.title: Directional Options Trading Is Not for Me (Typically)
item.description: I like directional trading but for the most part directional options trading is a hobby. There is nothing better than picking a direction, applying a leveraged bet via options or futures, and watching that trade take off. Here I will explain why directional trading is just a hobby.

item.title: Backtesting Options Is Here
item.description: Options Cafe backtester is here. Have you ever wondered how your options trading strategy would perform over time? I have, so I built a backtester. I wanted a way to simulate trading the options market day to day to see how well my strategies would have fared.

item.title: How do I connect Options Cafe with my broker?
item.description: Since all trade execution happens with our 3rd party broker partners such as Tradier Brokerage we need to create a link between your broker and Options Cafe. Upon signing up for Options Cafe you might be promoted to add your brokerage account. If not follow the following step after logging into the Options Cafe Application.  1) Click on "Settings" in the upper right-hand corner of the application.  2) Click on "Brokers" in the sub-navigation of the settings section.

item.title: Staying Engaged in the Market Is Key
item.description: When I first started Stockpeer I expected to mostly share my experiences trading the stock market via automation. But I find myself talking less about automation for an important reason: automation can lead to a lack of engagement—aka complacency.

item.title: Trading Futures as a Hedge
item.description: Recently I have been playing around with something new: trading the futures market as a hedge against my options trading strategy. Why hedge a good bet you ask? Though the strategy I rely on the most—trading put credit spreads on a consistent basis.

item.title: Does Option Cafe offer two-factor authentication (2FA)?
item.description: Yes. 2FA is an extra layer of security used to make sure that people trying to gain access to an online account are who they say they are. First, a user will enter their username and a password. Then, instead of immediately gaining access, they will be required to provide another piece of information. We highly recommend setting up two-factor authentication (2FA) with your Options Cafe account. If you want to secure your Options Cafe account with 2FA, you’ll need to log into Options Cafe using a Google Sign-In.

item.title: The Importance of Grading Your Trades
item.description: To start I want to point out 2 things: this idea is not originally mine, and though I talk mostly about trading I think the concept applies to all forms of investing (buy-and-hold, real estate, fixed income, and so on). From time to time I attend a meetup group.

item.title: Trading Weekly Put Credit Spreads
item.description: Want day trading returns without the headache of sitting in front of 26 big-ass monitors all day? You’re in luck because today we are going to discuss trading weekly put credit spreads on the SPY. The idea is pretty basic. I sell a put credit spread on the SPY that expires in 7 days.

item.title: I Took a Blogging Sabbatical and Didn’t Even Get You a Lousy T-Shirt
item.description: I’m baaaaaack! But that’s not to say I am returning empty handed. . . You did notice that I took a nearly 5-month sabbatical from Stockpeer blogging—right? The catalyst was the arrival of my second child, a dangerously sweet little girl!

item.title: September 2015 Trades
item.description: September was a tough month. The market took a major pull back. I lost a fair amount of money. I think if the next 3 months are good I should be able to recoup the losses. Some of the trades were rolled trades (the ones with high credits).

item.title: August 2015 Trades
item.description: Here we explore the put credit spread trades I placed on the SPY durning the month of August 2015. This is my primary trading strategy for monthly income. By trading put credit spreads on the SPY I am typically in a trade for 23 days but no more than 45 days.

item.description: Here we explore the put credit spread trades I placed on the SPY durning the month of July 2015. This is my primary trading strategy for monthly income. By trading put credit spreads on the SPY I am typically in a trade for 23 days but no more than 45 days.

item.description: Here we explore the put credit spread trades I placed on the SPY durning the month of May 2015. This is my primary trading strategy for monthly income. By trading put credit spreads on the SPY I am typically in a trade for 23 days but no more than 45 days.

item.title: April 2015 Trades
item.description: Here we explore the put credit spread trades I placed on the SPY durning the month of April 2015. This is my primary trading strategy for monthly income. By trading put credit spreads on the SPY I am typically in a trade for 23 days but no more than 45 days.

item.title: Picking an Investment Style That Suits You
item.description: Warren Buffett often says that he tap dances to work. He has found a method of trading that gets him high. I, however, would be bored to tears if I invested the way Buffett invests: I need more action, which is why I like to trade credit spreads and day trade the SPY.

item.title: March 2015 Trades
item.description: Here we explore the put credit spread trades I placed on the SPY durning the month of March 2015. This is my primary trading strategy for monthly income. By trading put credit spreads on the SPY I am typically in a trade for 23 days but no more than 45 days.

item.title: What Size Trades Should You Put on When Trading SPY Put Credit Spreads?
item.description: How much money should you risk with each trade? Trade size is one of the most important considerations of an active trading strategy, and maintaining optimal trade size over time involves technique. In this post we will examine 3 methods for determining trade size.

item.title: How I Day Trade the SPY
item.description: Many people think day trading is gambling: you might win for awhile, but eventually you will blow up your account. I agree—yet I day trade the SPY almost every day. Day trading is part of my overflow method and multiple strategy approach to managing my portfolio.

item.title: February 2015 Trades
item.description: Here we explore the put credit spread trades I placed on the SPY durning the month of February 2015. This is my primary trading strategy for monthly income. By trading put credit spreads on the SPY I am typically in a trade for 23 days but no more than 45 days.

item.title: eOption.com - Hands Down The Cheapest Trading Commissions
item.description: You’re just placing the same trades repeatedly, trying to rack up as many occurrences throughout the year as you can. But the more you trade, the more commissions impact your performance—which is why eOption.com is one of my favorite brokers for trading credit spreads.

item.title: Broker Finder—Find the Cheapest Broker for Options Trading
item.description: I routinely review and compare the broker commissions I pay, and I have realized that no one broker is the cheapest for every transaction. It comes down to the strategy you trade and how many lots per trade you place, which is why you need Broker Finder.

item.title: Baseline Strategy for Trading SPY Put Credit Spreads
item.description: When I got interested in trading credit spreads, like most I harbored some skepticism. A credit spread trade seemed to be the type that works—until rather dramatically it does not. Then I set off to figure out the correct way to trade SPY put credit spreads. The path was familiar: backtesting.

item.title: Scaling Your Investments via Overflow
item.description: When I talk to people about my credit spread trading strategy I often hear the claim that credit spread trading works great for 5, 10, or 20 thousand dollars, but the strategy can’t be scaled up. Are these skeptics suggesting a lack of liquidity to fill bigger orders?

item.title: January 2015 Trades
item.description: Here we explore the put credit spread trades I placed on the SPY durning the month of January 2015. This is my primary trading strategy for monthly income. By trading put credit spreads on the SPY I am typically in a trade for 23 days but no more than 45 days.

item.title: Should I Consider Delta When Opening SPY Put Credit Spreads?
item.description: To study how delta affects an opening trade I did—of course—some backtesting. I took a $10,000 account and placed put credit spread trades from 2011 to current. I opened up spreads that were $2 wide, at least 4% out of the money, and no more than 45 days to expiration.

item.title: Being Hyperfocused on the SPY
item.description: Almost all of my credit spread trading is focused on the S&P 500 via the SPY or S&P 500 futures. Why am I hyperfocused on the SPY? So I can sleep at night (well, try to sleep—I do have a young son and a daughter on the way).

item.title: How to Use the RSI Indicator to Trade the SPY
item.description: Every great trader has a bag of tricks. Each of these opportunities, if you will, is a predefined market condition signaling when to enter a trade and when to close it. One that has been in my bag for awhile is buying the SPY when the Relative Strength Index (RSI) indicator hits 30.

item.title: Mechanical vs. Emotional Trading
item.description: Like most traders I got started as a stock picker following the most basic of rules: do your homework and have a diversified portfolio. This credo is sound, and it’s the approach I use for some of my accounts.

item.title: Making Volatility Your Bitch
item.description: The day I learned to pay attention to volatility was the day I started to be consistently profitable in options trading. Most options traders start out trading stocks and they learn that if a stock is associated with good news its value often increases, whereas bad news sends a stock down.

item.title: How Often the SPY Falls More Than 5% in a 30-Day Period and Why You Should Care
item.description: During any 30-day period from 1993 through 2014 the SPY (the Exchange Traded Funds, or ETFs, tracking the S&P 500) closed down 5% or more 11% of the time. I know this obscure fact because for every one of the 5,502 trading days during that period I compared the SPY closing price with the closing price 30 trading days later.

item.title: How Much Do You Spend Each Year?
item.description: By my best calculations, going back to my piggy bank years, my personal spending has increased by 10% annually—and my assumption is that I will continue shelling out at this rate well into the future. Sure, I am a spender, but when you really think about it 10% is not crazy.

item.title: Options For Diversification : The Importance of a Multiple Strategy Approach
item.description: Anyone who manages their own money should use a multiple strategy approach—a form of diversification, if you will. I personally maintain 4 strategies: buying & holding stocks, investing in real estate, index option credit spread trading, and directional option trading. I find these to be great options for diversification.

item.title: December 2014 Trades
item.description: Here we explore the put credit spread trades I placed on the SPY durning the month of December 2014. This is my primary trading strategy for monthly income. By trading put credit spreads on the SPY I am typically in a trade for 23 days but no more than 45 days.

item.title: Happy Holidays the Stockpeer Way
item.description: I love this time of year: vacation, family, drinks, parties, gifts, Santa, and the rest are all great. Almost equally I love this time of year because I am reminded to take time to reflect on the past year, which gives me an opportunity to map a game plan for the coming year.

item.title: What Is So Special About Option Credit Spreads?
item.description: The catch is if your strategy is not well planned or implemented with discipline. Meaning that what makes the 3 factors so definitive when trading credit spreads is implementing a brilliant strategy with fidelity.

item.title: What Is a Put Credit Spread?
item.description: In the options trading world there is a type of trade called a put credit spread. The goal of this trade is to collect money and hope the market does not move against you.

item.title: What Is a Put Option?
item.description: A put option is the opposite of a call option—and if you don’t know what that is, see my previous post What Is a Call Option? This post uses a fictional scenario to illustrate the basics of what a put option is.

item.title: What Is a Call Option?
item.description: Let’s imagine that I have a tractor I am offering for sale for $20,000—which is a smoking deal because the same tractor is selling elsewhere for $25,000. My neighbor realizes that I am unaware of the fair market price and concludes that my tractor would be a good investment for him.

item.title: Step 1: Pick a Smart Trading Strategy
item.description: The difference between success, failure, and mediocrity on Wall Street is your ability to pick a smart trading or investing strategy and stick to it. Jumping into the market without first carefully defining your strategy is akin to driving a car with a blindfold on—and, likewise, you will crash at some point.

item.title: What’s the Difference Between Trading and Investing?
item.description: Wall Street is the domain of traders and investors. Typically we envision traders sitting in front of rows of monitors looking to make a quick buck by continually getting into and out of financial positions. In contrast, investors are the Warren Buffett types who buy and hold stocks for long periods of time.

item.title: November 2014 Trades
item.description: Here we explore the put credit spread trades I placed on the SPY durning the month of November 2014. This is my primary trading strategy for monthly income. By trading put credit spreads on the SPY I am typically in a trade for 23 days but no more than 45 days.

item.title: The Only Free Lunch in Trading Is a Consistent Trading Strategy
item.description: What I mean by a consistent trading strategy is if you build a smart trading strategy and stick to it you are almost certain to make money. I make this claim with such conviction because I assume that you backtest your strategy. That you factor in maximum drawdown periods (times when you lose money). And most critical, that you understand the importance of fidelity to your strategy—because inconsistent strategy is the road to a blown-out account.

item.title: Why I Am Sharing My Trades - October 2014 Trades
item.description: Below you will find all of the trades I closed out in October 2014. I plan to post a summary of my complete (not cherry picked) credit spread portfolio each month, and in the future I will share trades as I make them.

item.title: Hello Interwebs
item.description: Welcome to the inaugural blog post of Stockpeer.com. To find out more about me, Spicer, take a detour and check out the About page. To learn more about Stockpeer, read on.

item.title: About
item.description: About Options Cafe Options Cafe decided to take an entirely different approach: to excel in one area of trading — options only. Our options trading software provides an easy and efficient way to display the status of your options trades. We combine your multi-leg options into one trade strategy, making it easier to manage and monitor. By focusing only on options trading, our robust options screener is second to none.

Cloudmanic Labs, LLC collects information at the Site at two different stages.

item.title: Refunds
item.description: Refunds All paid plans must enter a valid credit card. Free accounts are not required to provide a credit card number. An upgrade from the free plan to any paying plan will immediately bill you. The Service is billed in advance on a monthly basis and is non-refundable. There will be no refunds or credits for partial months of service, upgrade/downgrade refunds, or refunds for months unused with an open account.

item.title: Sunset of Trading Platform
item.description: Looking to sign up for Options Cafe Trading? Howdy! Thanks for attempting to sign up for our Options Cafe Trading plateform. Sadly, in March of 2023 we decided to sunset this product to new users. You can learn all about the decision from my blog post here: Our Shift to Smaller, More Focused Products. If you have any questions, please feel free to email me at spicer@options.cafe. Thank you!
